Tucson salutes as well.  It was an opportunity he had been craving to take.=
  A chance to get back into active duty.  There would be no way he'd let hi=
s disability get in the way. Yet there were formalities that came with bein=
g blind.  This time, he was quite content having sharper hearing than sight=
.  He stands for a moment.  Sensitive audio equipment sends out sonar signa=
ls, as he waits to recieve them as they bounce off of objects.

"It's faint=
, but I do think someone is here.  I - just don't know if they're alive or =
not.  Signal is coming about seven hundred clicks due east.  Wait, I stand =
to be corrected..  This is strange, why am I getting a scattered reading?  =
I - don't understand this at all..  Ravenchief, Guardia, I don't like this.=
  Something isn't right."

He reaches for his cross bow, which is fully loa=
ded in hand.  He witholds all fire unless instructed to shoot.  He keeps hi=
s ears fixed on the signals bouncing back to him.  He hoped.  Just for that=
 one moment, to get a ping he can follow.  He sends out several more sonar =
signals, hoping that at least one of them would bounce back with answers.

=
